definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn

lit. three humble visits to a thatched cottage/cf famous episode in the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义 in which Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 recruits Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (the Hidden Dragon 臥龍|卧龙) to his cause by visiting him three times

sentences.english: INDIA'S technology firms are no longer spring chickens.
sentences.chinese: 印度的高新技術企業已經不再是剛出茅廬的小孩了。
他是個初出茅廬的作家。

sentences.english: I am inexperienced, but also invite more attention.
sentences.chinese: 我初出茅廬，還請多多關照。

sentences.english: She is a good driver, but as a mechanic, she is just a babe in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個好駕駛，但是她只是個初出茅廬的修車技工。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
Horizontal Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
to frame sb/to cook up imaginary charges against sb
